Fields.DialogueText: No matter the season, it's always windy out here when we're cruising at thirty knots.
And once again, Shropshire is running late.
Reporting as ordered, Captain.
But not at the ordered time.
Ah! Such a lovely breeze we get to enjoy out here on the bridge wing, isn't it?
Yes, it really–
Shropshire!
Come on. Don't stop calling me "Salop" just because you're annoyed.

Fields.MenuText: Heh. Okay, fair enough.
Fine, but don't change the subject like that.
"Salop" is such a strange name. Sounds like "sloppy."

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that's sorted. Hey, did I ever tell you about the time I--
Just a helpful reminder.
No, it does not!
What did you want to talk to me about?
First, we need to talk about your tardiness.
Aim those binoculars off the starboard beam. I think you'll find I'm right on time.
Oh, damn. Get us to battle stations!
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
Nice try.
Ah, well.
Quit checking your watch and take this - my after-action report.
And it's on time.
Hmm... Not a bad bit of shooting, Salop.
This Belle has seen a lot of action, and that means plenty of practice. More than most of my sisters.

Fields.MenuText: I'm still new at this, myself.
I have a few fights under my own belt.
I've seen a lot of action, too.

Fields.DialogueText: No need for modesty, Captain! You've got great instincts.
I should say so. You handle combat quite capably.
That's easy to see. It inspires confidence among the crew.
Thanks. You have a lot of faith in me.
One thing the report doesn't really do justice to - in our last fight, some of those hits we landed on the Morganas seemed...
Lucky?
Right.
Get used to that. I've always had more than my share of luck.
*ALARM*
More Morganas. Guess we can't be lucky all the time.
Let's make some luck of our own!
@BATTLE
I do! And my sense of people's character is never wrong.
As long as they don't root around in your costume bag.
Precisely. Plus, the kittens like you.
That just means I'm warm and can feed them.
Essential qualities in a commanding officer!
Heh.
Did I forget to wind my watch?
*TICKING*
Nope, it's keeping good time. Unlike Shropshire.
Hullo, Cap!
Salop! Lose track of time again?
No, not at all. Just helping the crew with some work on the capstan.

Fields.MenuText: I needed you here for the operations brief.
Quite helpful of you, but I'd rather have you here on time.
I'd assumed you were pinned down by the cats again.

Fields.DialogueText: Please forgive my tardiness, but they needed my help.
Of course, Captain.
Not this time! I have witnesses!
That capstan maintenance would have taken them all day without some help.
The crew has their duties, but I need to make sure you focus on your own as this ship's Belle.
I assure you, Captain, I am always mindful of my duties. In fact, I—
*ALARM*
This has to wait. Morganas!
@BATTLE
Heh.
Thanks again, ma'am. Everybody on the No. 2 gun appreciated your help.
Don't mention it, love. This Belle was happy to put her muscles to good use.
Attention on deck!
Carry on, sailor.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Maintenance is complete on all guns, Captain. Anything else that needs doing?
As a matter of fact, yes.

Fields.MenuText: Take a break. We all need our rest.
The food in the galley could be better.
Anything but another musical.

Fields.DialogueText: I never sit still for long, Captain!
Ha! I'm a girl from the English countryside, not a French chef.
Listen, I think that cast reading went very well.
I'll come up with something.
@BATTLE
No.
*ALARM*
That's not the impression I got from Ica.
Well, maybe if I convince her to sing herself she'll be more-
Here's some inspiration now.
Never a dull moment...
Take a walk with me on the weather decks, Salop.
Gladly, Captain.
Fair weather we're having.
Yes, it's lovely, but please tell me we have a new assignment or something to do.
I'm expecting patrol orders from Command before long. For now, just walk with me.
Of course. I—
Hey! Sailor!
Captain. Ma'am.
At ease.
Not so fast, sailor. Chin up and back straight! We've got a war to win.
Yes... Yes, ma'am!
That's better. Stand tall!

Fields.MenuText: No room for slouching aboard, eh?
Try not to contradict me in front of the crew, please.
This isn't a finishing school. We're a warship.

Fields.DialogueText: Not if I can help it.
You're right, Captain, but I couldn't ignore what I saw.
It still matters.
I pay close attention to the crew's morale. Strong posture shows a strong will.
I doubt there's a Belle with better posture than you, Salop.
@BATTLE
... I also can't ignore Morganas.
*ALARM*
Still no orders from Command. At least I'm getting some reading done in my cabin.
*KNOCK*
Do you have a minute?
The door's unlocked, Salop.
*sigh*

Fields.MenuText: That's a face I have never seen you make before.
What's troubling you?
Are you hiding from someone?

Fields.DialogueText: Is it that obvious?
It's about the crew.
If I can't solve this problem, I might have to.
We still don't have orders from Command, and I'm running out of new and interesting ways to keep the crew occupied.
I guess you can only have so many wheelbarrow races and belching contests before people get bored.
Exactly! I need help coming up with ways to keep the crew motivated.
*ALARM*
How about blasting Morganas?
Not quite what I had in mind, but it'll have to do!
@BATTLE
Anything from Command, sailor?
No priority messages yet, Captain.
Captain, I got it!

Fields.MenuText: Keep it down in the radio room, Salop.
Did you get our new orders?
That sounds wonderful... but what the heck are you talking about?

Fields.DialogueText: Pardon the outburst. I'm just really excited!
No, but I have something almost as good.
Let me catch my breath and I will tell you.
I've got the best idea for a crew activity! It's going to be such fun!
Well? Spit it out!
That would ruin the surprise!
I'm not sure I like the sound of this.
*ALARM*
Or the sound of that.
Time to get to work!
@BATTLE
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
Attention, all hands! Attention! This is your Belle speaking!
Why is she using the loudspeaker? I need to get to the bridge and sort this out.
Stand by for the signal to commence!
Ahem.
Oh! Hiya, Cap.

Fields.MenuText: What's going on here, Salop?
Is this the "crew activity" you were talking about before?
Are we under attack?

Fields.DialogueText: We're just about to get started.
It is!
Nothing of the sort!
I've got something special arranged to keep the crew entertained.
You never told me what it was, you know.
I thought you might enjoy a surprise. Captains need to have fun, too.
And they need to know what their Belle is up to.
Don't fret about a thing. I promise it won't make too much mischief.
That's hardly reassuring, Salop.
Your mouth says, "That's hardly reassuring," but your heart says, "Thrill me!"
... Oh, what the hell. Thrill me.
*WHISTLE*
Let the games begin!
We've got multiple enemy contacts! Let's give them what for!
@BATTLE
Shropshire's playing some kind of game with the crew, but wouldn't tell me what it's all about.
Plus, I can't find any of the crew to ask what's going on. This cruiser's become a ghost ship.
Another empty space. Looks deserted here in this ammunition storage compartment.
Maybe I can find one of the chiefs in berthing.
Empty in here too. Where is everybody?!
*giggle*
I heard that! Come out where I can see you!
Damn! You found me. Does this mean I'm out?

Fields.MenuText: On a warship, we don't sleep under the bunk.
Why aren't you at your post?
Out of your mind, maybe!

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't sleeping, Captain. Honest!
Shropshire said she would cover our stations during the game.
Ha! It was Miss Shropshire's idea.
Miss Shropshire organized a ship-wide game of hide and seek, and if you... You didn't know, Captain?
Shropshire apparently thought it would be more fun if I didn't know.
I'll be heading back to my post now, Captain.
Even though you caught me and I'm out, it was still fun.
All right. Carry on, sailor.
One down. A thousand to go? I'll need some help. Hey, sailor, come back!
Captain?
If you aren't hiding any more, help me look for the rest of the crew.
Aye-aye!
Have a seat, Salop. I've been looking forward to this.
Appreciate the invite, Cap! It'll be splendid to share a cup of tea with you.
We need to talk.
Oh. That sounds quite serious. Maybe our tea won't be so splendid?
It's about that game of hide and seek that you organized for the crew.
Ah, that. Are you upset with me?

Fields.MenuText: No, but I wish you had told me before doing it.
It was an insane stunt! What if the Morganas attacked while everybody was hiding?!
Not at all! I thought it was a brilliant idea.

Fields.DialogueText: I was just trying to make it more fun for you, Captain.
The crew all had instructions to quit playing if I sounded the alarm, Captain.
Really? I'm thrilled you enjoyed it!
The crew says they loved it. It cured their boredom and got everybody together.
You've always got the crew's interests at heart, Salop. But next time...
Let me know before you organize something like that, all right?
So, we can have a next time?
Well...
*ALARM*
So much for a quiet cup of tea. Finish that cup and meet me on the bridge!
Already on my way, Salop!
@BATTLE
Coming through! Excuse me! Coming through!
What's the rush?
Oh, it's you! The radio room wanted me to tell you that we have a priority message from command, Captain.
Sounds important. I'm taking my coffee to the bridge. Call me as soon as they have the message decrypted.
Aye-aye, Captain. Excuse me, Miss Shropshire.
I overheard. New orders for us, Captain?
That's my guess, but we'll know for sure in a few minutes.
Well, it's about bloody time.

Fields.MenuText: Don't get your hopes up. I'd bet my bottom dollar it's another routine patrol.
It could be anything.
You seem far too eager for combat.

Fields.DialogueText: An encrypted priority message? I doubt that, Captain.
Anything suits me.
I'm never eager for bloodshed, but I'm eager to serve where I'm needed.
In war, a cruiser's proper place is anywhere that she can make a difference.
Wait with me on the bridge, and we'll have our answer soon enough.
*ALARM*
First things first! Let's put these Morganas down quickly.
I'm right behind you, Salop.
@BATTLE
Captain! Captain! Where are you? CAP-TAINNNNN!
Sounds like I have contact with an incoming Belle...
Captain! Look! We've decrypted the top secret message!
Salop, if you don't mind, please avoid running down passageways waving top secret messages and shouting.
Ah... I was just...

Fields.MenuText: You might knock somebody over being careless like that.
Not everybody on board has the security clearance to see that message.
You can just appear wherever I am, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I love every single person aboard! I'd never hurt our crew!
Haha! That's why I waved it around while I ran to find you! Nobody could possibly read it that way!
But this way is more dramatic!
So, what's it all about?
HQ needs us to mobilize quickly to defend a merchant ship that has been damaged in a Morgana attack. Let's go!
Salop, I don't know where or what... Come back with that message! I still need to read it!
*ALARM*
Salop!
@BATTLE
Very funny.
Cup of tea? Mind your hands, it's hot.
Thanks, but we still haven't talked about the merchant ship mission from HQ.
Well, we were distracted by those Morganas. Now we have a bit of quiet time, so we can talk.
Don't jinx us like that.
All right, but mind that you don't spill any tea on it!
Is this it? Horizon Dawn?
Aye, Cap. She's a merchant that took a bad shot to one of her engines and needs an escort to safety.
That sounds like she needs help, but...
But what?

Fields.MenuText: Who did the damage? Are we walking into a trap?
Why would HQ be so secretive about a simple escort mission?
We're a warship, not a babysitter. HQ is wasting our time with things like this.

Fields.DialogueText: If somebody needs our help, then I shall never refuse!
Hmm...that's a sharp question, Captain, but I don't know the answer to that one.
You know what a warship is supposed to do? Its duty! Especially to protect those in danger!
Let it be noted that your enthusiasm for a mission is never lacking...
C'mon, Cap! Weren't you getting bored? I know I was! Besides, HQ wouldn't have tasked us without a good reason.
Fair enough, Salop. I'll have the navigator plot a course to rendezvous with the merchant Horizon Dawn.
I don't know if I can wait that long! I want to go, go, GO!
*ALARM*
Auuggghhhhh!
First things first! Let's put these Morganas down so we can get on our way.
Aye-aye!
@BATTLE
Right. Come over to the navigation chart and show me.
I'm lucky, remember? It's a quality that supersedes all jinxes, hexes and assorted maledictions.

Fields.MenuText: Great. You've double-jinxed us.
Duly noted.

Fields.DialogueText: But I'm at least triple-lucky, Cap.
It's always too hot here in the engine room... but right now, it's a damn blast furnace!
Crack that valve! Gimme more cooling water on the starboard side! Can't lose vacuum on the condensers, mates!
Talk to me, Chief.
Ah, Skipper! Welcome to the engine room!
What the heck is going on here?!
Everything just fired up hot all of a sudden. Turbines are screamin' like I ain't never seen before!

Fields.MenuText: Something's wrong with Shropshire!
Maybe the throttles just got stuck.
Shropshire is too excited for this mission and can't control herself.

Fields.DialogueText: If there is, it ain't mechanical. I've checked every valve and bolt, Skipper.
Already checked those myself, Skipper. Throttles are workin' just fine.
Ha! That's the only explanation I can see.
We've got a Belle that's got her mind made up to go as fast as she can. Do you know what's wrong with her?
I can't say much about the mission, but it's to help out a damaged ship.
That's our Belle. Ain't nothing gonna stop her from givin' aid where it's needed the most.
Carry on, then. Do your best to keep us in one piece.
Aye, Skipper. We're no good for a rescue if we end up needin' one ourselves!
Shropshire... why won't you settle down?
*ALARM*
Great... Going so fast that we tripped over some Morganas...
@BATTLE
Whew! I worked up a mighty sweat, Captain!
You pushed yourself hard. Chief and his mechanics were giving it everything they had to keep you from melting down the engine room.
Next time we'll break out the oars and get an extra knot or two! Ha!

Fields.MenuText: Don't ever do that again unless I order it. I'm the Captain.
Not funny. You could have put us dead in the water.
You're really dedicated to rescuing that merchant, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I only meant to—to get to the rescue as fast as possible. I didn't mean to be insubordinate.
Don't worry! This country girl is made of iron, inside and out. I'd never put the crew in danger.
Horizon Dawn needs our help, Cap. We have to get there fast!
Just keep it under control. I can't have us burning up or stumbling over Morganas without warning.
Aye, Cap. You've got my word.
Captain to the bridge! We have radio contact with Horizon Dawn!
I'm on my way.
I'm sensing something... Horizon Dawn isn't the only contact out here.
Morganas?
Looks like we got here just in time!
@BATTLE
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
That's the last of them. Ha! That'll teach Morgana bullies not to pick on noncombatants!
Great shooting, Salop. Get on the radio and send Horizon Dawn the "all clear" while we see what we're dealing with.
Already bringing us alongside her for a good look... Oh my. Captain, get your binoculars out and take a look at her.
What is it?
Dawn is a tough girl, but she's taken a brutal shelling. See those big holes near her waterline?
Now I see them. Amazing that she's still afloat! Can she even make it to Brisbane before she sinks?
I hereby recommend sending Chief over to Horizon Dawn to attempt repairs before we begin the escort mission.

Fields.MenuText: Great idea! If anybody can sort out their engine room damage, it's Chief.
I'm not sure. We might need to keep Chief on board to get our own engine room through a gunfight.
Not going to happen. If that merchant sinks, I don't want to lose our best mechanic.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you think so! If Chief is willing, of course.
I understand the concern, but maybe Chief could give a second opinion on the matter.
All the more reason to send Chief! We can't lose that ship–it's our mission!
All right, I'll leave it up to Chief to make the final decision.
Wonderful! I do hope Chief agrees to help them out!
I'll head aft right now and ask.
Any word from Chief?
The initial reports from Horizon Dawn indicate that damage to her engine room is severe, but manageable.
What's the estimated time before she's seaworthy enough to get underway with us?
Chief radioed. He said it'll take a few more hours.

Fields.MenuText: HQ can't wait forever. Tell Chief to hurry up.
Incredible. It would probably take them weeks on their own.
Good. Maybe we could spend a few of those hours together while we wait?

Fields.DialogueText: You saw that damage, didn't you? Chief is working miracles on that poor merchant ship, and you should acknowledge that!
Indeed. I'm quite proud of our impressive crew!
Oh? I'd love that...
Can we go somewhere private? Your cabin, perhaps? There's something I'm quite keen to show you.
And we can't do it in front of the crew. We don't want them peeking!
Are you all right, Cap? You look flushed! And why are you looking at me like that?
I'm fine, I just...
*ALARM*
Blast! Those evil witches, attacking at a time like this!
Guns up, Salop. While Horizon Dawn's still dead in the water, we have to shield her.
They won't lay a dirty finger on her, Captain.
@BATTLE
Should I be worried when you make that face? It sounds like you have something in mind.
As a matter of fact, I do!
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
Take the binoculars and have a look from the bridge, Chief. See that?
Thank you, Miss Shropshire. Ah, there she is... Horizon Dawn. Safe and sound in Brisbane.
Mission accomplished! HQ ought to be quite pleased, wouldn't you agree, Captain?
You did a great job putting that merchant ship's engine room back together, Chief. Outstanding work.
Chief?
Chief?
Pardon me, Skipper. I was just... taking a moment.

Fields.MenuText: Take all the moments you need. You got that ship safely to port, and you should be proud of that.
Get some R&R in Brisbane. You earned it, and you could use a break.
Fine, but try not to cry all over my binoculars too much, you big baby.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm prouder of my mechanics who got Horizon Dawn running again. Fine sailors on this crew, Skipper.
Aye, Skipper.
Haha! Aye, I'll dry 'em off before I hand 'em back, Skipper! Just feeling a bit of pride in my chest, is all.
By your leave, Captain. And yours as well, Miss Shropshire.
Of course.
I'm still not sure why Horizon Dawn was so important for HQ. Secrets in her cargo hold? A VIP passenger?
We might never know that, but we completed our mission. Besides, we aided and protected a ship in need.
Good enough reason for me. I'll grant the crew a bit of shore leave in the city.
Are you going to take some liberty in Brisbane as well? If not, maybe we could do something together here while the crew is out.
Like what?
Can we use your cabin? We were interrupted last time, but maybe now will be better.
Your face is all flushed again. Are you all right? Let's get you in bed so you can lie down.
Oh no! Your eyes look like they're going to pop! Let's hurry...
Whew! Well? What did you think of that? Did you enjoy it?
That was... not what I was expecting at all.
I didn't realize you wanted to meet privately in my cabin... to discuss a party for the crew.
I'd hate to ruin the surprise for them. Now, quit dancing around and tell me what you think about my idea.
About having an arm-wrestling tournament on board? Well...
Can we do it?

Fields.MenuText: Somebody might get hurt.
Sounds exciting! A little competition can bring out the best in the right people.
Arm-wrestling? Strange choice, but I suppose it can't be too hard to organize something like that..

Fields.DialogueText: Don't underestimate the crew, Cap. They're tough!
My thoughts exactly! It feels good knowing we're of a like mind.
If this tournament is going to be fun, we need to plan it like a party.
I want everybody to have fun, even if they don't compete. That means food, drinks, decorations...
And impromptu theatrical productions?
Ha! Maybe not this time. We'll let the competition be the drama.
Don't get too carried away, but you have my approval. Let me know whatever you need.
I love knowing that I can count on your support, Captain.
I also love...
*ALARM*
Knowing we can always count on Morganas to interrupt? Let's get out of the harbor and beat them back!
@BATTLE
This is incredible! When did all of these decorations go up?
Quite a spread of food and drink in the galley, too!
Who put all of this together?
I'll wager this is the work of an extra special Belle, kid.
Brilliant guess, Chief. All for an extraordinary crew, of course.
The crew has performed so admirably throughout this patrol. You deserved a small celebration.
Thank you, Captain!
Don't be fooled! Your Belle did most of the work. Also, she has something special planned.
That's right! We're having... an ARM-WRESTLING TOURNAMENT!
Captain, they're not saying anything. Did I do something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: They're just stunned by how much fun this tournament will be!
They'll have fun once the tournament starts. Don't worry.
Maybe an arm-wrestling tournament wasn't such a great idea.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you really think so, Captain?
I hope you're right, Captain.
At least there's still good food and drinks...
Miss Shropshire, I think it's a wonderful idea. Thanks for organizing it. Can I be the first to sign up?
Of course you can, Chief. Any other takers?
Um...
Come on, give it a try.
All right. Can I borrow your pen? Who's next after me?
*ALARM*
Another rude interruption!
Time to show them what happens to Morganas that try to cut in line.
@BATTLE
To your stations! Don't let them get away!
@BATTLE
The first round of the ship's arm-wrestling tournament is underway! Show off your strength and your sportsmanship!
That's an announcement I never expected to hear over the loudspeaker.
I'll admit, an arm-wrestling tournament is a strange idea, but I needed something new for a crew activity.
The crew seems to be enjoying it just fine, Salop.
Well, I tried my best to think of something good.
You always try your best. That, plus an uncanny bit of luck now and then, always seems to work in your favor.
Hard work and enthusiasm can solve a great many problems, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Those are your two best qualities.
Heavy cruisers with big guns can scare up a few solutions, too.
Will they help you in an arm-wrestling tournament?

Fields.DialogueText: And they're not my only two, but I'll take that compliment!
Those guns only fire in anger when other solutions fail. Fighting is always my last choice, you know.
If you want to find out, you know what you have to do.
So... are you going to join the tournament, Captain? It's not too late.
I can't. It would be unfair to everybody in the crew, making them compete against their boss.
I suppose you're right.
But you can still cheer everybody on! Want to come down to the messdecks with me and enjoy watching the competition?
Take my arm, and let's go together.
Aye-aye, Captain!
I won my fifth round! Who's next?
I'll inform all of the winners of their next opponents. In the meantime, enjoy the food and cheer on your shipmates!
Yes, ma'am!
They adore you, Salop.
That's kind of you to say, Captain.
I spent a lot of time organizing the tournament and arranging the brackets for the competition.
So, you drew some names from a hat? Need any help?
Don't worry. I have it all arranged... And by the way, you have an opponent coming up soon, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I said I wasn't going to compete, Salop.
Who?
Good! I actually wanted to arm-wrestle somebody in this tournament.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry. I found you somebody that won't present a professional conflict.
Be patient. I'm going to make an announcement soon.
Ha! I'm glad to hear you so eager, Captain!
Attention, all hands! In the next round, the Captain will be arm-wrestling!
The Captain's opponent will be...
Me!
Whoo hoo! Good luck, Captain! You'll need it!
What?!
*ALARM*
Looks like we have another wrestling match first. Why do they keep interrupting our fun?
Battle stations, Salop. But save some fight for me!
@BATTLE
Shrop and the Captain are next!
I just got another beer, so I'm ready to watch.
Here we go!
Are you ready to arm-wrestle me, Captain? I have an empty chair for you at my table.
As ready as I'll ever be. Are you?
Roll up your sleeve! I'll even let you feel my arm muscles first. Go ahead and give it a squeeze!
Your bicep...

Fields.MenuText: Whoa! Your bicep's like steel!
If you're trying to intimidate me, it's working!
If you're trying to intimidate me, it's NOT working!

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! What did you expect? I am the embodiment of a warship, after all!
Ha! Don't worry, Captain. I'll be gentle...
Ha! Let's see if I can change your mind in the next few seconds!
Take my hand so we can get started. Oh! Your hand is... warm. Are you blushing again?
No! It's just that your hand is... softer than I expected.
You were expecting calluses and warts? Haha! Quit flirting with me and get ready to lose!
Is she going to slam my hand right through this table? I hope she doesn't break my arm...
What was that? I couldn't hear you.
Nothing!
I'll do a countdown for you both, Skipper.
Three!
Two!
One!
*ALARM*
No! Ugh...
Battle stations!
Salop?
Yes?
We need to get to the bridge.
Yes, I know.
You have to let go of my hand.
Oh! Hehe... Sorry. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Unusual. Most unusual. I see my Belle with a priority message from HQ, coming down the passageway...
... and she isn't running at me or shouting with excitement...
That actually scares me a bit. Is this message bad news?
Priority message for you, Captain. Here's the folder.
HQ sends their appreciation for HMS Shropshire's outstanding service to assist...
... a critically damaged merchant vessel... vital repairs... escorting said vessel to safe harbor...
... protecting hundreds of civilians critical to the war effort... and their families.
Salop, did you read this message yet? It's a commendation from HQ for aiding Horizon Dawn.
I did. I'm sure the crew will appreciate some praise from HQ.
Are you all right?
Just moving a bit slowly today, Cap. Take no mind of it.

Fields.MenuText: Too much partying at the arm-wrestling tournament?
Damage control must have missed something after that last fight. I'll get Chief.
You've got something on your mind, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Haha! No, this country girl can handle a few drinks.
Captain, there's no undiscovered damage. I promise you, everything is fine.
Just doing a bit of reflecting, Cap. I'll be right as rain.
I'm concerned about you. Whenever you want to talk to me, I'll be there.
I'll take you up on that, and soon.
*ALARM*
If you're not ready for a fight right now, the crew can handle this one.
I know. But YOU know I'd never miss the chance to drive back a Morgana!
@BATTLE
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
Salop?
*KNOCK*
Are you awake in there? I've got some good news to share.
I'd never refuse a visit from you in my quarters, Captain. The door is unlocked, so come right in!
A tray of tea for us? Lovely. And... AH! You brought Sarah to see me!
*MEOW*
I missed my kitten. Come here, sweet pet! Oh, what's that paper in your hand, Captain?
If I'm intruding, I can come back later.
No, please stay with me for a bit. I'd like to share something with you.
I'm all ears, Salop.
I'm still disappointed about the arm-wrestling tournament.
Really? Is it because we never got to actually compete when the Morganas interrupted us?
We both know you'd put my hand through that wooden table if you wanted to!
I didn't regret the competition. I just... when I held your hand... I felt something...
And then the alarm sounded and the Morganas took that moment away from me.
I wanted that moment back.
Tell me something, Captain. Am I a complete and utter fool, or do you want that moment back, too?

Fields.MenuText: I'll admit it—I felt something, too.
I'll admit it—I wanted to prove that I could have beaten you!
I'll admit it—I want that moment right now.

Fields.DialogueText: You did? I...I thought so, but I needed to be sure.
Haha! That's something I love about you. You can always put a smile on my face!
Oh? Now I'm the one who's blushing!
You've got the biggest heart of anybody I know. You'd do anything for your crew.
I'd do anything for the people I love...
For the Captain I love.
Then let's enjoy this moment a little longer. After that, I have an idea for a fun activity I've been planning.
Once we're done with this tea, of course.
Is it for the whole crew? Haha! If not, we should make sure that door is closed.
Definitely a "closed door" activity. Just for us.
Oh!
